info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 02 at 3:15AM MDT by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...PATCHES OF DENSE FOG DEVELOPING EARLY THIS MORNING ACROSS PORTIONS OF THE EASTERN MAGIC VALLEY, RAFT RIVER REGION, AND LOWER SNAKE RIVER PLAIN... At 315 AM...Area weather stations, webcams, satellite, and spotter reports were monitoring expanding pockets of dense fog. Visibility in these pockets ranged from one mile to as low as one-tenth of a mile. The worst conditions were occurring near the interchange of Interstate 84 and Interstate 86, at Conner Summit, just west of Pocatello Regional Airport, and just north of Blackfoot along Interstate 15. Model guidance suggests fog will continue into mid-morning and may occur in other spots as well. Anyone traveling across the eastern Magic Valley, Raft River Region, or the lower Snake River Plain this morning should be prepared to suddenly encounter dense fog. When entering fog, slow down, use extreme caution, switch to low beam headlights if possible, and use painted roadway lines to help guide you.
